Posts.Content: Hi, I had a lumpectomy and sentinel node removal and had to be in hospital for 7am. I had the nuclear injection/blue dye on that morning, also wires put into my breast which linked up to the titanium marker they put in when I had a scan/mammogram. I had to go back for second incision and more tissue clearance last week but didn't have to have the blue dye again.
Posts.Title: Radio active dye during lymph node removal

Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply Lynn xx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - week 3 of 3

Posts.Content: I told my GP I wasn't depressed so he never prescribed me any antidepressants, I did have a thyroid test but it was ok. In the end I just put my tiredness down to the fact I'm travelling backwards and forwards staying at my caravan in Wales where I do a lot of walking, I'm quite active........for my age. Since my cancer op I've felt really well but I'm not looking forward to going back for second incision, but it has to be done so there's no good moaning about it.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - week 3 of 3

Posts.Content: I was due to start a course of 3 weeks radiotherapy, but after my lumpectomy they found, under microscope I had another type of cancer growing in the breast tissue, so I have to have another operation on 15th of this month before radiotherapy. When I do have it, it will be a 60mile round trip to the hospital and as I am a widow will I be able to Drive?
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - week 3 of 3

Posts.Content: I certainly would never drive if I didn't feel 100%, because if you did have an accident I doubt whether your insurance company would cover you.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - week 3 of 3

Posts.Content: Thank you very much for your reply, think I'll wait and see how I feel. I've had offers of help taking me there but I'm an independent sort of person, but there again I wouldn't want to cause an accident. I know a man who had treatment for 8 weeks and drove there himself but I expect it affects people differently.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - week 3 of 3

Posts.Content: I'm 70 yrs old, had a letter for a routine mammogram at one hospital, then a few days later had a letter to go for another mammogram, scans and biopsies at the main hospital and they told me on that day that I had cancer. 2 weeks later I had a lumpectomy and when I went back to see the surgeon he said they'd found cancerous cells under microscope in some breast tissue. So I have another operation on the 15 th, so it's all been quite a shock and unbelievable as I don't feel unwell. In June this year I felt tired and lethargic and went to Drs and he said it was depression but I just put it down to old age.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - week 3 of 3

Posts.Content: Hi Judith, Thank you for your reply, I was wondering myself if I'd got an infection in my breast as it's very tender to touch and does look inflamed in one area, sort of at the top of my breast from my nipple, it is red. Can't say it's swollen though. Even the GP I saw on Friday said it looked inflamed and I asked if I could have antibiotics and he said no, but I suppose it could be the reason why I'm feeling so lousy. I'll try and make an appointment to see my own GP tomorrow unless the BC nurse rings me first. Thank you ever so much for your reply, thank goodness we have this forum to air our concerns otherwise I'd feel completely left out in the blue.  xxxx❤️
Posts.Title: I THINK I NEED MORE SLEEP.......

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I've been taking Anastrozole since the end of November and haven't slept much since although I feel totally exhausted. Finished my 15 sessions of radiotherapy about 3 weeks ago, then last Monday I developed some sort of virus which affected every part of me. Headache cold, aching limbs, diarrhoea and painful breast (lumpectomy one). I don't know whether the pain in my breast is to do with having a virus, tried ringing the BC nurse but she didn't ring me back. I managed to see a a GP (of sorts) on Friday but he was more bothered about my boob being a turquoise colour, even though I told him it was normal as I'd had a nuclear inj for my op. I do feel a bit better today although I wish I could..........sleep Thanks for listening to me moaning on xx
Posts.Title: I THINK I NEED MORE SLEEP.......

Posts.Content: Thanks again, unless I can see my usual GP the others are pretty useless, that's if you can get past the receptionist to get an appointment in the first place. Kind regards, Sue x
Posts.Title: I THINK I NEED MORE SLEEP.......

Posts.Content: Awww bless them, that looks like a lovely cuddle and yes I could do with lots of cuddles Thank you very much xx
Posts.Title: I THINK I NEED MORE SLEEP.......

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm on Anastrozole for 5 years, then afterwards I've got to take Tamoxifen for a further 5 years. Hope that you go on alright yourself, it's good to chat on here though xxxx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen - 1 year on

Posts.Content: Hi windinsails, I'm not taking Tamoxifen but another cancer drug called Anastrozole, I've been on it for about 6 weeks and thought I was doing quite well apart from aching bones, headache at times, then last weekend I had this terrible taste of salt in my mouth. My second cup of tea was awful, tasted more like salt water. I'd already got an appointment at Drs last Monday as I'm sure it's a side effect of the drug, but because I've suffered from acid reflux for years I've got to go and have the camera down this Friday. Although it doesn't state this as a side effect of the drug I'm on, on the packet, I have done some research and found that any cancer drug might give you an unpleasant taste in your mouth. Hope this helps although you're taking Tamoxifen xx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen - 1 year on

Posts.Content: Hi,  I've had 10 treatments so far of radiotherapy after a lumpectomy, sentinel node removal then I had to have a second incision operation to get clear margins. I've been told not to put anything at all on my breast until my treatment has finished.......only 5 to go. I'm always glad of the weekends off as the round journey to hospital is 60 miles, but yesterday I felt lousy, very lethargic and tired, then today I've got a migraine. I just don't seem to be able to get anything done at home, I'm just glad I haven't a young family to look after. Good luck to everyone else xxxx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy questions

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm taking anastrozole and I've had a bone density scan, my friend who had the operation the same day as me is taking Tamoxifen and she didn't need a bone scan, both of us are post menopause xx
Posts.Title: Bone density scan, should I have had one?

Posts.Content: Hi Kitkat59, I've been taking Anastrozole since the end of November and no real drastic side effects. I get the odd headache now again which might not be due to the drug, Aching bones and limbs, sometimes I feel very irritable and lack patience with people but at the moment I'm feeling stressed out because I start radiotherapy next week every day for 3 weeks. It's not the treatment I'm worried about but the fact that the journey to the hospital and back is 30 miles and I just hate travelling, didn't bother me when I was younger but I'm now 70 and just scares me tbh. Hope that you'll be ok on Anastrozole, I think that whatever cancer drug you take just like any drug there will be some side effects, I suppose it all depends how severe they are. I do get really tired at times but then I did beforehand, trouble is with me when I do feel well I tend to get jobs done and never stop instead of pacing myself out. Good luck with your treatment x
Posts.Title: Bone density scan, should I have had one?
